original_solution_mapping.L1: Bob has 5 rows of corn, each with 80 corn stalks, so he has 5 rows * 80 stalks per row = <<5*80=400>>400 corn stalks.
original_solution_mapping.L2: 8 corn stalks will produce a bushel of corn, so Bob will harvest 400 corn stalks / 8 corn stalks per bushel = <<400/8=50>>50 bushels of corn.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 4410.
    Returns: the total number of bushels of corn Bob will harvest.
    """
    # L1
    num_rows = 5 # 5 rows of corn
    stalks_per_row = 80 # each row has 80 corn stalks
    total_stalks = num_rows * stalks_per_row

    # L2
    stalks_per_bushel = 8 # every 8 corn stalks will produce a bushel of corn
    total_bushels = total_stalks / stalks_per_bushel

    # FA
    answer = total_bushels
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Bob has {num_rows} rows of corn, each with {stalks_per_row} corn stalks, so he has {num_rows} rows * {stalks_per_row} stalks per row = <<{num_rows}*{stalks_per_row}={total_stalks}>>{total_stalks} corn stalks.

{total_stalks} corn stalks will produce a bushel of corn, so Bob will harvest {total_stalks} corn stalks / {stalks_per_bushel} corn stalks per bushel = <<{total_stalks}/{stalks_per_bushel}={total_bushels}>>{total_bushels} bushels of corn.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: Bob has 5 rows of corn, each with 80 corn stalks, so he has 5 rows * 80 stalks per row = <<5*80=400>>400 corn stalks.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: 400 corn stalks will produce a bushel of corn, so Bob will harvest 400 corn stalks / 80 corn stalks per bushel = <<400/80=5>>5 bushels of corn.

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'stalks_per_row' (80) was used instead of 'stalks_per_bushel' (8).
